channel.title: Comments on: An Observation About The Chevrolet Malibu Signaling Lights
channel.description: Amit Schreiber's Blog | הבלוג של עמית שרייבר

item.title: By: Ariel Cohen
item.dc:creator: Ariel Cohen
item.description: Is Rokaset the drug which people use in NJ to get those strange illusions? I heard it is much stronger than Marijuana...
item.content:encoded:
Is Rokaset the drug which people use in NJ to get those strange illusions?
I heard it is much stronger than Marijuana…

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: Rokaset Plus, too ;) I see you're all well now, accusing me of using drugs again :)
item.content:encoded:
Rokaset Plus, too ;)
I see you’re all well now, accusing me of using drugs again :)

item.title: By: xtreeq
item.dc:creator: xtreeq
item.description: Amit, I told you a thousand times already: STOP WITH THE DRUGS !!!!! Marijuana is bad for the brain...
item.content:encoded:
Amit, I told you a thousand times already: STOP WITH THE DRUGS !!!!!
Marijuana is bad for the brain…

item.title: By: Amit
item.dc:creator: Amit
item.description: I'm 100% sure that this is what happens. But like I said I'm not sure that it's a 1 second delay for the turn-signaling (which brought me to the 1.5 second conclusion). I believe that it's possible with the Malibu to create a situation where only the middle light (M) is signaling the break for more than one second.
item.content:encoded: I’m 100% sure that this is what happens. But like I said I’m not sure that it’s a 1 second delay for the turn-signaling (which brought me to the 1.5 second conclusion). I believe that it’s possible with the Malibu to create a situation where only the middle light (M) is signaling the break for more than one second.

item.title: By: Ariel Cohen
item.dc:creator: Ariel Cohen
item.description:
In American cars the break and signal light are the same for many years now. Are you sure that L is lit only 1.5 second after the driver hits the break? I never noticed anything wrong...
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automotive_lighting#Center_High_Mount_Stop_Lamp_.28CHMSL.29
Are you envy at people with a Chevy :)
item.content:encoded:
In American cars the break and signal light are the same for many years now. Are you sure that L is lit only 1.5 second after the driver hits the break?
I never noticed anything wrong…

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Automotive_lighting#Center_High_Mount_Stop_Lamp_.28CHMSL.29

Are you envy at people with a Chevy :)
